result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason T. Couture was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Ashland County Case 06CF29 and Bayfield County Case 11CM224

While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations through the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806
All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts Office are subject to a civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed 60 days from entry of judgment.

miscConds.notes: All financials added to payment plan $35 per month beginning 5/1/18
Successfully complete Domestic Violence Perpetrator's Class/Course, as directed by the department of Corrections.

Contact with Jamie Corbine only if she consents and only if determined by the Department of Corrections.
  Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are possessed or consumed.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

Transcript of Sentencing Hearing on December 21, 2016

16CM79 and 16CM141. Defendant Jason T. Couture in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Defendant Jason T. Couture in custody - Dodge Correctional.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  in 16CM141 agreemnt reached - See offer to settle.  Count 2 and Count 3 - pleads NC.  Count 1 and 4 DRI.  Goes over right to be physically present in courtroom, no threats or force to appear by telephone it is his preference to appear by phone.  Court rev complaint, fact basis exist, court accepts pleas find guilty.  Sentence:  CTD, MBJ.  State complied with V/R.  Victim declines to make a statement at this time.  DA Kressel makes comments about sentencing.  Perrine comments about sentencing,  Defendant comments about sentencing.  Sentence:  180 days jail concurrn to one another, 0 days CTS, wk, good time, period of probation and jail time both run consecutive in cases 06CF29, 11CM224.  Conditions - Upon rel from prison report to DOC asap, enroll and succ compl dome vil program, contact with Jamie Corbine limited to that contact approved by DOC, obtain AODA, follow through, other counseling as recc by doc, rest tbd, 10 fine plus costs each count 488.88, dna specimen.  Pay fina ob at rate of 25/mo starting May 1, 2018.      16CM79:  Set for trial:   04-28-2017 09:00 am 12 person JT #1.  STC 04-17-2017 at 1:15 p.m.
